Case reference: 2014006086.CaseDesc: Martin Geoffrion was last seen on April 26, 2013 in Montreal. He left his home around 4:00 pm in a Mercedes vehicle. On April 30, 2013, the Mercedes was located in a cul-de-sac in St-Roch de l'Achigan. According to his relatives, Mr. Geoffrion was not suicidal. He loved fishing and playing golf.

Case reference: 2018039090.CaseDesc: On December 6, 1996, at approximately 10:00 a.m., San Lee was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, San was terminally ill and despondent.

Case reference: 2014006224.CaseDesc: In January 2013, Da Wang was seen for the last time by his fiancé in Buffalo, New York. However, the two continued to communicate through text messages for several months. On July 11, 2013, at approximately 7:18 p.m., Da’s fiancé received a final text message from him indicating that he was in trouble.

Case reference: 2008006798.CaseDesc: Jason Russell was last seen at the Casino in Niagara Falls. Mr. Russell was a student at Brock University in St. Catharines, Ontario.

Case reference: 2023070202.CaseDesc: Salman Shuaib was last seen near Table Rock in Niagara Falls, Ontario, early in the evening of December 25, 2023. At the time of his disappearance, Salman was feeling despondent.

InfoSection: White, Blue, Flag, Flag of Israel

Case reference: 2012003299.CaseDesc: David Wardle lived alone in Wilberforce, Ontario. He worked off and on at a local mill and kept mostly to himself. During the fall of 1981, Mr. Wardle advised a family member that he had gotten into some trouble and would be leaving for awhile to get it straightened out. Approximately one week later Mr. Wardle and his truck were missing from his home. Family members are concerned for his well-being as his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2005002199.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1980, a Caucasian male was found at a campsite (Lot 19, Con 8, Peck Township) on Hardwood Lookout Trail in Algonquin Park. The death is estimated to have occurred between July 1, 1971 and Spring 1978.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Possibly in a ponytail
Belt: 36 inch, wear shown at 32 inch hole
Other: A folding camp stove; and an aluminum camper's pot with a lid
A black down-filled sleeping bag with a nylon outer shell
Wallet: Black, with 8 cent stamp issues between July 1, 1971 and September 1, 1976

Case reference: 2014005713.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1980, Michael Konopekly was seen for the last time when he went fishing on Pallet Lake, near Cochrane, Ontario. Mr. Konopekly’s canoe, paddle and fishing rod were located at the lake, but Mr. Konopekly was not located.

Case reference: 2008020199.CaseDesc: On May 7, 1973, Donald MacGregor was seen for the last time in Miami, Florida, after leaving for a business trip to Panama City in Panama.

Case reference: 2014004779.CaseDesc: On May 3, 2006, Mr. David Robillard left a cultural camp with the intention to walk back to his home community of Black Lake, SK. He was not seen again.

Deformity: Right Leg, walks with a limp

Case reference: 2014005330.CaseDesc: On September 13, 2009, at approximately 6:30 a.m., Rose Mackinnon was seen for the last time when she left the Earnestine Women’s shelter with her two children. Rose advised that she would be returning but has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003608.CaseDesc: Brianne Wolgram was last seen on the evening of September 5, 1998, in Revelstoke, British Columbia.  Ms. Wolgram had plans to socialize with friends that evening but did not attend.  Ms. Wolgram's vehicle was located on September 10, 1998 on the Alkolkolex Forest Service Road near Revelstoke.

Case reference: 2014003474.CaseDesc: Christine Pelletier was last seen on July 21, 1988, in the Vieux-Rosemont District of Montreal, Quebec. Christine lived with friends, was engaged in a high-risk lifestyle, and may have been suffering from mental health issues.

Tattoo: Left Shoulder, Winged horse on the back of the shoulder. Possibly a Pegasus

Case reference: 2006020499.CaseDesc: Theodore Piekarz was initially reported missing in 1978. Piekarz was planning a trip to British Columbia. He was seen at the Kirkland Lake Train Station in October 1986. Mr. Piekarz may suffer from mental health issues, including suicidal tendencies.

Mark: Nose, mole on the right side of his nose

Case reference: 2014005229.CaseDesc: On March 25, 2009 at around 11:00 am, Ronald Hallam was seen for the last time on his property on Prosperity Line road in the municipality of Ashfield-Colborne-Wawanosh, Ontario.

Pants: Brown, Khaki, Light brown work pants

Case reference: 2015049567.CaseDesc: Raymond Chalifoux was last seen on May 25th, 2015 at the Fort St John Hospital. Mr. Chalifoux received abdominal surgery and left the hospital against the advice of medical staff. He left in an unknown direction. Extensive searches were conducted with negative results. Mr. Chalifoux has not been seen or heard from since.

Vest: Black, Black vest with designs on chest

Case reference: 2008002499.CaseDesc: On August 21, 1983, three men were doing some repairs to a dock at the cottage when they heard a male voice shouting "Help" three times approximately 5 seconds apart. All three witnesses observed a boat turning in circles. Two of the men ran to their boat and went to the out-of-control boat. They found the boat unattended. They were unable to locate the victim, Robert Kennedy. The boat ran ashore and Mr. Kennedy has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006019599.CaseDesc: Frank Szpak left his residence on September 23, 1996. He indicated he was going to pick blueberries and never returned. Mr. Szpak suffered from Alzheimer's Disease.

Hat: Blue, Baseball cap with "Motorola" on the front

Case reference: 2016061850.CaseDesc: On February 20, 1978, the body of a male was found in the snow on the east side of the Bayview Extension, near the east end of Labatt Ave, on the west bank of the Don River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 158lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Unshaven, beard and moustache
Coat: Dark grey winter coat with a checkered pattern
Pyjama: Blue, White, Blue and white patterned pyjama bottoms
Scarf: Black, blue and red plaid scarf
Shirt: Maroon, Black, Maroon and black sport shirt
Mark: Left Hip, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
Left Arm, Number of unswollen red-brown, circular contusions
Right Arm, Number of unswollen red-brown, circular contusions
Left Abdomen, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
Right Leg, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
Left Thigh, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
3 scabbed abrasions around the left eye orbit.
Scar: Numerous small, old, healed, circular scars on a forearm
Abdomen, Numerous small, old, healed, circular scars
Shoulders, Numerous small, old, healed, circular scars

Case reference: 2018038616.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2018, Cameron Richard Betker was reported missing by family.

Case reference: 2010002299.CaseDesc: Susan Gourley was last seen in late November of 2001, by a friend, in the area of Barton Street and Stirton Avenue, in downtown Hamilton.  She was reported missing by her mother February 28th, 2002.

Case reference: 2014005853.CaseDesc: On Friday August 10, 2012, Bernice Carnahan was last seen from the Rabbit Lake Saskatchewan area at approximately 9:00 a.m. At approximately 11:45 p.m. that evening, Ms. Carnahan's abandoned vehicle was located in the Battleford area near Finlayson Island but her whereabouts remain unknown.

Glasses: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, wire rimmed

Case reference: 2014003823.CaseDesc: On June 6, 1996, Patricia Ferguson was seen for the last time in the Pointe-aux-Trembles district of Montreal, Quebec. That night, Patricia had slept at a friend's place but had left the apartment, without her young daughter. She left a note saying she was going out for breakfast, and then meeting her sister. Patricia has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014040212.CaseDesc: On October 24, 1991, Terry Patrick was seen for the last time at a motel in Pueblo, Colorado, USA. Terry was scheduled to go on a hunting trip with his friend on November 4, 1991, but never showed up.

Case reference: 2020001488.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1988, Edward Parsons was seen for the last time as he was dragged from his apartment by a street gang in Toronto, Ontario. Edward was taken to a beach where he was violently assaulted, and buried in a shallow grave. The police were informed of this incident, and attended the grave. Upon their arrival, the alleged burial site was found empty.

Case reference: 2014004558.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1992, at approximately 9:00am, Rodolfo Morales was last heard from when he spoke to his friend over the telephone.

Case reference: 2014001413.CaseDesc: Captain Charles David Tillsley, Warrant Officer Tyrus Cobb, Sergeant Major James Mackey and fourth companion departed Fort Churchill for a weekend fishing trip on the Churchill River. They were last seen loading their gear into a boat around 1:00 pm at the Churchill Dock. They were expected back on Sunday September 20th, 1959 but failed to return. The Fort Churchill Military authorities commenced a search with the aid of helicopters and aircraft. On September 21st, the two boats the men used were located, both were swamped and undamaged. Numerous items were found and were identified as belonging to the four men. Extensive land and water searches were conducted.

Case reference: 2012020090.CaseDesc: In 1993, a human foot and running shoe were located along the North Saskatchewan River near Prince Albert, SK, approximately 1 km west of the river forks. The foot was examined by the University of Saskatchewan Department of Archaeology. It was determined to be that of a robust male, size 10, big boned, and athletic, likely between the ages of 30 and 60.

Case reference: 2014003364.CaseDesc: On June 27, 1992, Heather Miller was reported missing by her boyfriend. Ms. Miller was believed to live a transient lifestyle, and could have traveled between Vancouver, BC, Merritt, BC, California, USA, and possibly as far as Australia.

Case reference: 2015050297.CaseDesc: On April, 23, 1973, Lucie Gélinas was seen for the last time in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. She was supposed to go to Vancouver, British Columbia with a friend. Investigations were conducted and the location of Lucie and her friend have been unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2006009799.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1974, Francis Foster, Robert Warren and another friend departed for a canoe trip on Basswood Lake, Quetico Park, 45 miles (72 km) south of Atikokan, Ontario. It is believed that the canoe overturned and all three are presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2011006199.CaseDesc: Clifford Scruton, age 48, was known to frequent the downtown area of Kitchener and was of no fixed address. He would attend downtown medical centres and withdrawal management for drug and alcohol abuse. Mr. Scruton was last seen in mid-July 2003 at the Downtown Health Centre in Kitchener, Ontario.

Hair: Black, White, Straight, Short, Grey/black, messy; Beard
Teeth: Visible Missing, Irregular, broken/missing lower and upper  - decayed

Case reference: 2020049381.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2020 Sean Hart was last seen leaving Seven Oaks Receiving Home in Victoria, British Columbia.  Sean has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2016061228.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1970, a male was found floating in Lake Ontario near the mouth of the Humber River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 201lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to several days.

Shoes: Black, only the left shoe has laces

Case reference: 2014003304.CaseDesc: Milde was last seen in 1993 where his vehicle was abandoned near the City of Lethbridge Landfill. Footprints in the snow were seen leading from the vehicle into the coulees and disappeared.

Case reference: 2006005599.CaseDesc: On October 25, 1980, Foster Bezanson departed the Abitibi Road 48 area near Cochrane, Ontario to go hunting.  Mr. Bezanson failed to return and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004819.CaseDesc: Reginald Andrew FLETT (known as Reggie) was last seen walking around downtown Thompson, Manitoba shortly before his disappearance on either September 16th or 17th, 2007. FLETT had also been spotted earlier near both the Thompson Walmart and the Extra Foods. He was reported as missing by a family member on September 19, 2006.   Shortly thereafter, family members from Split Lake, Manitoba conducted searches around both Split Lake and Thompson, both of which failed to uncover any trace of FLETT. Thereafter, missing persons posters were distributed throughout Thompson. Although FLETT's whereabouts remain unknown, the investigation is ongoing.

Case reference: 2014004400.CaseDesc: Deoclides Santos was last seen on November 27, 2003, in Kitchener, Ontario, by his son.

Case reference: 2011002299.CaseDesc: On March 24, 1991, four-year-old Michael Dunahee went missing from an area of the playground at Blanshard Elementary School in Victoria, British Columbia.  At the time of his disappearance, Michael was at the playground with his mother, father, and younger sister.

Jacket: Cloth, Blue, Hooded with red lining and red cuffs
Shoes: Canvas, Blue, Sneakers with red and orange trim

Case reference: 2014005522.CaseDesc: Charlie Nguyen was seen for the last time on November 9, 2010 in the area of the foot bridge that connects Louise McKinney Park and Henrietta Edwards Park in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2021014442.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2018, Phillip Jordan was seen for the last time by witnesses as he entered the water’s edge at Prospect Point, Niagara Falls in New York state. During the time of his disappearance, Phillip was despondent.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Black and white anchor

Case reference: 2006021199.CaseDesc: Guy Labreche and Rick Dechaine were last seen at the airport in Sioux Lookout, Ontario on September 12, 1987 as they departed on a return air trip to Thunder Bay, Ontario. Mr. Labreche was the aircraft pilot and his Cessna is presumed to have crashed.

Case reference: 2006017999.CaseDesc: Agnes Battersby was visiting a friend in Barrie, Ontario; who then drove her home around 1:30 a.m. on July 28, 1968. She was unable to walk very far due to her disability. She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2022032399.CaseDesc: On May 25, 2022, partial skeletal remains of this man were found in a forested area near Salmon Arm, British Columbia. He had a severe fracture to his right lower leg during life, which required surgical intervention. He likely died many months to years before his remains were found.

Foreign Object: Right Leg, fracture to right tibia with surgical implant

Case reference: 2017074234.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2016 an unidentified male believed to be between the ages of 40 to 75 years old was discovered in Jayfield Park in Brampton, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005631.CaseDesc: Daniel Schultz was last seen by family on May 10, 1996 at a wedding in Chemainus, British Columbia.  Daniel was a dual citizen and lived in Seattle, Washington.  Seattle Police Department had contact with him after the wedding.  Daniel has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2019043440.CaseDesc: On August 1, 2019, Victor Cuthand was reported missing from the City of Brockville, Ontario. Victor’s last known whereabouts were at a shelter located in downtown Toronto, Ontario, as of March, 2020. This was also the last time that Victor had communicated with his family.

Case reference: 2014002591.CaseDesc: Richard Kelly Little went missing on May 23, 1997. Richard was last seen at residence in Port Coquitlam. Richard was also known to be transgender.

Case reference: 2014002734.CaseDesc:
Martin Munawych was last seen the day he left a relatives residence near Lac La Biche, AB, he appeared to be happy at the time. 
It is believed that may have been travelling to Edmonton or Calgary. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014002334.CaseDesc: Gary Percival was reported missing in Regina, Saskatchewan, on April 9, 1973. A witness did state that Gary may have been a patient in a hospital in New York State in 1974. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003140.CaseDesc: Anthony Philip Porter was last seen on June 26, 1969 while he was picking up groceries near his home in the city of Kimberley, British Columbia. He never returned. Anthony is developmentally delayed.

Scar: Right Calf, Two inch scar on right shin
Head, Half inch scar over the right ear

Case reference: 2007000199.CaseDesc: Eric Ram was last seen at 9:00 a.m., on October 5, 1991.  He left his residence to go to the local store to buy milk and a paper and never returned.

Hair: Brown, Wavy, Thick brown beard, moustache
Scar: Left Forearm, From wrist to elbow

Case reference: 2014005346.CaseDesc: In August of 1987, Dale Sinclair was last seen as he left his home in Edmonton, Alberta, driving his wife’s vehicle. Dale had planned to cash a cheque at the bank, and then intended on visiting family in Gibbons, Alberta. On August 12, 1987, the vehicle he was driving was recovered by the police in Regina, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2020040348.CaseDesc: Muriel Jones was seen for the last time in 1959 in Toronto, Ontario. Muriel had indicated that she was intending on traveling to the West.

Case reference: 2021023928.CaseDesc: On April 08, 2021, Dale Hallett was last seen at an RBC ATM in Hinton, Alberta.  Dale usually wears sweatpants or coveralls with a long sleeve shirt.

Hair: Grey, Other, Grey hair & moustache, partially balding

Case reference: 2021059908.CaseDesc: On June 16, 2016, the partial remains of an unidentified man were recovered in Renews, Newfoundland. Between 2016 and 2018, additional remains belonging to this man were recovered.

Case reference: 2018059603.CaseDesc:
After new information has been brought forward, investigators believe Lisa MACEACHERN was last seen in downtown Calgary, Alberta leaving a business located in the 800 block of First Street S.W., on Wednesday, June 27, 2018. Lisa is also believed to have been staying at a residence in the 1000 block of First Street S.W., prior to her disappearance. 

There are no footprints of life following Lisa’s last known phone contact with her family, which occurred on Tuesday, July 3, 2018. She has not been heard from since. 

It is uncharacteristic for Lisa’s family to have no contact with her, and they continue to be concerned for her welfare.

Case reference: 2014001648.CaseDesc: On August 31, 1986, Gustave Focktave was seen for the last time when he left his home in the Côte-Des-Neiges-Notre-Dame-De-Grâce District of Montreal, Quebec. Gustave had left without his possessions and had left a farewell letter addressed to his family indicating that he would be hitchhiking to British Columbia to live in Vancouver. Gustave is originally from Madagascar.

Case reference: 2006023399.CaseDesc: John Allen Bowes was last seen in Nipigon, Ontario getting gasoline on August 15, 1992. He was travelling eastbound toward his home in Kingston, Ontario. Mr. Bowes usually wears a baseball cap.

Case reference: 2014005000.CaseDesc: On August 10, 2004, Mr. Lathlin was reported missing to police by his wife. She indicated to police the last time she saw Mr. Lathlin was on June 14th at which time he was leaving for Winnipeg from The Pas for a medical appointment on the 15th. He did not take any clothing and only took personal grooming items. Mr. Lathlin later called advising his wife he would be staying in Winnipeg as he had another appointment on Thursday. He again called his wife on Saturday morning asking for money. His wife sent the money as requested, however by Tuesday it was not claimed and it was returned to her. Mr. Lathlin has a history of living on the streets and has ties to Edmonton where he spent years on the street there. He also has various medical concerns. It is believed that Mr. Lathlin is likely in Winnipeg of his own volition. Mr. Lathlin's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2013000004.CaseDesc: John Wade was last seen at his parents home on June 17, 2012 in Halifax, Nova Scotia. He left on foot while distraught, leaving behind his identification, bank card and money. He has been known to reside on the streets and does have connections to Edmonton, Alberta. John has previously hitchhiked across Canada. He suffers with mental illness issues.

Teeth: Good, Upper front tooth is capped

Case reference: 2014002474.CaseDesc: Kenley Matheson was a student at Acadia University, Wolfville, Nova Scotia in September 1992. On September 21st it was reported that he was seen by a friend walking on Main Street in Wolfville, N.S. This was the last time anyone has seen or heard from Kenley Matheson.

Coat: Nylon, Blue, Helly Hansen, mountain coat
Jewelry: Gold, Necklace - gold eagle pendant, 1 IN
Metal, White, Watch - White Face Seiko, 8M2571000, SN 040792
Gold, Earring worn in left ear

Case reference: 2006010299.CaseDesc: On November 11, 1970, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Edward Bucharest and his son, Barry Bucharest, were last seen by their family members in Kenora, Ontario. The pair had left from their cottage located on Kimberly Road, north shore of the Big Stone Bay in the municipality of Lake of the Woods, in a 14-foot fiberglass boat. The capsized boat, two life jackets, and other belongings were subsequently located.

Case reference: 2014001248.CaseDesc: William Roy Tennant left his home in the Municipality of Leamington, Ontario, on October 5, 1990. William was reported missing on October 9th, 1990, by his sister, who was concerned about his mental health.

Case reference: 2016050062.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2016, Jami Springer was last seen in Moncton, New Brunswick.  Since then, no one has heard or seen Jami, and the police consider her disappearance as suspicious.

Case reference: 2016061381.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1970 a Caucasian male was found in the ravine just north of Beechwood Ave. The ravine was located 300 yards south of the Leaside Bridge and approximately 100 yards east of the Don River.

Other: Rifle - Winchester Model 94 30-30 calibre, with a black and white rifle case

Case reference: 2012020012.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Surtel was last seen April 28, 2007 at his residence in Mission, BC. Jeff is believed to have left his home riding a distinctive blue CCM mountain bike with yellow forks.

Case reference: 2014002370.CaseDesc: On June 16, 1997, at approximately 4:30 pm Kelvin Zdarski and two friends left Dauphin, Manitoba and headed for a cabin near Waterhen, Manitoba. Over the course of the evening there was an argument between the men. Kelvin left the cabin and never returned. The men looked for him on their way back to Dauphin and did not see him. A man matching Kelvin's description was seen walking on the road at 7:30 am on the 17th of June. An extensive search by land, air and water proved negative. Kelvin did not take his wallet, money or any identification to the cabin and had no means of transportation. Mr. Zdarski has not been seen or heard from again.

Scar: Left Calf, 1 inch long, back of calf

Case reference: 2023001420.CaseDesc: On November 7, 2022, Sohail Shahid was seen for the last time at Terrapin Point, American Falls, Niagara Falls, New York. Witnesses observed Sohail jumping over the railing. At the time of his disappearance, Sohail was despondent.

Case reference: 2014001767.CaseDesc: On October 15, 1991, Mario Chouinard was seen for the last time while hunting on the Zec Festubert(controlled harvesting zone) located in the municipality of Clovas in the Abitibi-Témiscamingue region of Quebec. Mario has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2008016399.CaseDesc: Nikki Lysanewitch has been missing since July 1994.  He was last seen leaving his residence near Bobcaygeon, Ontario.  His pick-up truck was later found parked at the Toronto International Airport.

Case reference: 2016061151.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2014, a male was recovered from a reservoir behind Energy Ottawa, building #511 at 4 Booth Street, Ottawa. His appendix and gallbladder are present. It is believed that he had been in the water for a few days to a few months.

Hair: Brown, Medium length; balding and face stuble
Teeth: Extensive amount of dental work including root canal, crowns, posts and composite resin fillings.
Other: Red, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 2 disposable lighters
cigarettes in a white opaque plastic container
a hand drawn map of the Richmond Rd/Churchill Ave area, drawn on a torn off cover of a notepad
folding knife with built in nail file and opener on a ring
3 keys (SM "ILCO" key, Curtis "SC1" & Oscar "WR3" house keys)

Case reference: 2013000043.CaseDesc: On September 4, 2010, Jonathan Jette and Rachael Bagnall went hiking in a mountainous region north of Pemberton, B.C. They intended to spend 2 to 3 days climbing some peaks in the area. They failed to return and were reported missing. Their vehicle was located however despite an extensive search, no other trace of them has been found.

Luggage: Light Green, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 4 person tent
Sweater: Wool, Brown, White, zip up sweater (Hudson's Bay type)

Case reference: 2022014037.CaseDesc: On March 23, 2022, Roger Vidito was seen for the last time as he left his residence in the west-end of Ottawa, Ontario. Roger grew up on the east coast of Canada, and there may be a possibility that he travelled there.

Case reference: 2014002160.CaseDesc: Jackelene Bylow was last seen at her residence on November 13, 1994 after having dinner at a restaurant near Willington Ave and Hastings St. She suffers from mental illness and addicted to drugs and alcohol.

Tattoo: Chest, Duck and blue bird on right breast

Case reference: 2019068654.CaseDesc: On November 16, 2019, Lara Parkin was seen for the last time in the South-West District of Montreal, Quebec. Lara is known to frequent Montreal’s downtown area and parks. She is also known to travel by foot or by public transit. During the time of her disappearance, Lara left her apartment without bringing any of her belongings.

Case reference: 2014004061.CaseDesc: On March 10, 1984, Robert Dwyer was seen for the last time when he left his residence at the Keirstead Trailer Park, which is located on the west side of Saint John, New Brunswick.

Jacket: Grey, Bomber, dark grey corduroy front

Case reference: 2023012025.CaseDesc: On March 6th, 2023 shortly after 12:00 pm, Kimberly Jackson was last seen in the area of Prospect Point, American Falls, in Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of her disappearance Kimberly was despondent.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Samurai skull with a knife

Case reference: 2014004763.CaseDesc: On October 28, 2005, Leslie Thompson was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Leslie is known as a gambler and frequents bars.

Case reference: 2017023773.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017 the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Ottawa River near Wendover, Ontario. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this man was either of European ancestry, or Middle Eastern/North African ancestry, or mixed European and Middle Eastern/North ancestry.

Case reference: 2016066678.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1966, the remains of a male were recovered from the Maid of the Mist Landing, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 175-180 lbs and his length was measured at 5'11", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Black, Short, Shorter than collar length, greying

Case reference: 2014005757.CaseDesc: Harley Boxall was seen leaving his residence in Nanaimo on March 9, 2012. A suicide note was located in his room suggesting he was going to drown himself. However, within weeks of being reported missing, there were unconfirmed reports of Mr. Boxall within the city of Nanaimo or that he may be residing with the homeless community in Vancouver’s lower-Eastside.

Case reference: 2010006499.CaseDesc: On May 23, 2007, Mark Brazau was reported missing by a friend.  Mark was last seen at his place of work in Toronto Ontario.

Hair: Brown, Short, Over ears, receding hairline, beard and a moustache

Case reference: 2014001853.CaseDesc: On May 19, 1958, Clifford McKell and a friend were last seen having supper and told friends they were going out in the canoe. Neither of the men were considered experienced paddlers. No one witnessed the men leaving in the canoe. The following day they were reported missing by their employer when they failed to report to work. Police commenced an investigation and an air search found the overturned canoe. Paddles and safety cushions were also located. A witness who saw two men in a canoe around 8:30 pm indicated they were headed in a southerly direction and the lake was quite rough at the time. It is presumed Mr. McKell drowned.

Case reference: 2014005302.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2005, in Toronto, Canada, Zaina Trujillo-Talib was abducted by her father, Chaudhry Talib and her paternal grandmother, Shama Talib.  Chaudhry and Shama immediately took six-year-old Zaina to their family home located in Lahore, Pakistan.  Since this time, Zaina's mother has not been allowed to have any contact with her daughter.

Case reference: 2014003314.CaseDesc: Dorothy Spence was last seen panhandling near a bridge in downtown Vancouver by a family member on or about August 17, 1995. Ms. Spence was of no fixed address and was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. Foul play has not been ruled out in Ms. Spence's disappearance.

Case reference: 2013000125.CaseDesc: Bonnie Joan Thomas (née Cooper) of Rollingdam, just outside of St. Stephen, NB, met with some friends and went across the U.S. border to the Legion in Calais, Maine.  They went to a St. Patrick's Day dance. After the evening's celebrations, Bonnie left the Legion alone in her red 1973 Volvo station wagon. She drove back through the Calais/St. Stephen border crossing into Canada. At the Canadian entry point Bonnie hit the customs booth causing minor damage to her car. She was last seen talking to the Customs Officer. The next morning her husband realized she was missing, and called the police. Bonnie's car was found abandoned on March 18, 1978, near St. Stephen on a logging road near the St Croix River.

Case reference: 2014001414.CaseDesc: On September 15, 1967, Sarah Ovayuak was last seen as she fell into the Tuktoyaktuk Harbour while trying to board a Coast Guard vessel.

Case reference: 2014005841.CaseDesc: Alfred Sassin has not been seen since he left his home in downtown Vancouver on July 9, 2012. Mr. Sassin's absence was reported to police by the resident caretakers on July 16, as they had not seen him for over a week, which was unusual for him.

Case reference: 2014004487.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2003, at approximately 9:00 a.m. a fisherman and his helper, Phillip McKay, left Berens River Manitoba to retrieve their commercial fishing nets from Sandy Bar Bay. Upon arrival, one of the nets got caught in the propeller of the boat motor, pulling the boat down. Shortly thereafter, 2 large waves capsized the boat and both men were thrown into the water. Both men were wearing oilers, making it difficult to swim. The fisherman survived and was treated for shock and hypothermia. The body of his helper, Phillip McKay was never located.  Phillip McKay is presumed dead due to drowning.

Deformity: Right Leg, Crooked, walks with a limp

Case reference: 2016068328.CaseDesc: This male foot was found washed up on the shore of Gull Island in Presqu'ile Provincial Park. The foot was inside a black "PUMA" ankle sock and a size 11 women's "Mizuno Wave Prophecy" running shoe. The shoe was first available for sale in Spring 2011. The post-mortem interval is anywhere from one month to 2 and a half years.

Case reference: 2017034100.CaseDesc: On June 19, 2017, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Olumide Arigbede was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005158.CaseDesc: Frederick Lagrelle was last seen on April 12, 1997 in the area of the Sunchild and O’Chiese First Nations in Alberta. It is possible he was seen in Rocky Mountain House, Alberta days after. He was known to walk with a cane and wear a leg/knee brace. Frederick was described by family as having an intellectual disability as a result of a past accident.

Case reference: 2008003999.CaseDesc: Bernard Champagne was last seen on July 10, 1997.  He was a bachelor and lived alone for 40 years in a cabin with no running water or electricity, located behind the Rodrigue residence.  Richard Rodrigue was concerned that night had fallen and Mr. Champagne had not returned to his cabin.  Mr. Rodrigue contacted the police and a search by canine, helicopter, and E.R.T. was conducted but proved unsuccessful in locating Mr. Champagne.

Case reference: 2014027689.CaseDesc: Sindy Ruperthouse's family has had no news of her since April 2014 and on September 2, 2014, they reported her missing to the Sûreté du Québec of Amos. Mrs. Ruperthouse was last seen in Val d'Or on April 22, 2014 during a consultation at the Local Community Service Centre (CLSC).

Case reference: 2014005251.CaseDesc: On May 18, 2009, at approximately 12:00 p.m., Fabio Dapello was seen for the last time by his father as he left to go to work. When Fabio’s father returned home, both he and his mother were gone.

Case reference: 2014002963.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1990, Nicholas Leonard was seen for the last time rowing a homemade kayak towards the north end of Lower Loon Lake in the town of Wabush, Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2014006179.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, Burnaby RCMP were advised that Lon Batchelor had sent his brother a letter requesting he become his power of attorney and that he give his daughter a good-bye note (stating that Lon was "going for the long walk"). This is out of character for Lon. Anyone having seen Lon since July 1, 2013, or who may be able to provide any information as to his whereabouts, is asked to contact the police.

Case reference: 2019015016.CaseDesc: On March 14, 2019, at approximately 5:30 am, Monica Duah was seen for the last time by her friends at her work place in Toronto, Ontario. She failed to show up to work for her scheduled shifts.
